pageContext.claim: “We called them [China] on manipulation and they brought their numbers back, and they brought them back rapidly. And they were able to do that because they manipulate. But that's -- so it's called ‘monetary manipulation.’ Not good.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump frames this as cause and effect, claiming that China reversed its moves after the United States labeled it a currency manipulator on Aug. 5. What actually happened is that China made moves that unexpectedly depreciated the value of the yuan shortly before the U.S. announcement. Experts do not widely agree that China manipulates its currency, though Trump and some analysts insist that it does.
